abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Mining Sector
            Capacity Building Project was rated as satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned include: 1) Project Preparation Facility
            should be used in project preparation to build ownership of
            the project and to establish the project coordination unit
            (PCU). 2) All hard conditionalities should be accomplished
            during project preparation and before project approval
            and/or effectiveness for faster project implementation. 3)
            Senior level commitment to the objectives of the project and
            inter-ministerial coordination are crucial for success. 4)
            Effective integration of the PCU into the line Ministry is
            important for smooth project implementation. 5) The Bank
            should build into the procurement procedures mechanisms to
            facilitate greater use of the local consulting firms
            services and individual national consultants during project
            preparation and implementation. 6) Reforms in the mining
            sector will not be effective without the Government's
            commitment to transparent governance. 7) To deal with issues
            beyond the mining sector, selection of a strong and dynamic
            country project team leadership is essential. 8) Staff
            working in the mining sector should be kept informed in a
            timely manner on the market dynamics, best practices, bench
            marks and other related matters.
